file_content.text: I, uh, really don't need to know any details about what you're up to.
What good are Mandalorians if they can't escort a few trade shipments? It's not like we need them for the war.
Stop obsessing about the mercenaries, Obenth. You wish you could carry a vibroblade?
You get vicious after a while, don't you?
Sure. I'm going to go talk to someone else now.
She's a brat, but she's got spirit. Want to break it?
And look at you. Enjoying yourself? It's not the worst party I've ever been to... but it needs improvement, you know?
You're Samara Mindak, aren't you?
Samara?
That's me. Not everyone gets to walk up and talk to me, either. Lucky I need someone new.
You're military, right? A very special alien officer, allowed into the best cantinas on Dromund Kaas?
You're military, right? You've got the look--and the weapons.
I know what you mean--but things are looking up now.
It's getting better.
Yeah, I guess. Are military girls allowed to have a good time?
I get that a lot. Not usually from guys like you, though--military guys, I mean.
You are military, right? Not a lot of aliens walk in here without a chaperone--I figure you've got to be very special.
You are military, right? You've got that in-charge kind of look--and the weapons.
I'm not military. I'm from Imperial Intelligence.
You're close.
I see. You going to make me mysteriously disappear?
Let's say you're right... does that have an appeal?
[Flirt] I got your interest.
Maybe it does. Depends if you're more than just pretty skin and eyes.
Maybe it does. Depends if you're more than just the look.
You're right--or close enough. But don't let it scare you.
No need to be alarmed.
I'm not scared--not enough to make it a bad thing.
I'll ask the questions. You're going to answer.
None of your business.
Hey--hey, all right. You want to be that way, I can take it.
Samara, be careful. You need to take this seriously--
Don't waste my time--I'm here on business.
I'm not here to chat.
Say things like that, you're gonna scare people off--make it look like you're throwing your weight around.
Samara, be careful. This looks like a military thing--
Shut up, Obenth. I said I'm done with you.
So tell me--how can I serve the Empire?
There are anti-government radicals operating on Dromund Kaas. Tell me about them.
Let's talk about terrorists.
I don't know what you're talking about. My dad's the one who always complained about the government.
I came looking for a dangerous man--but I suspect you're much better company.
[Flirt] Let's chat awhile.
Oh, forward. I like that.
Though... my dad doesn't approve of military guys--hard to know what they're really after.
Right now, I'm only interested in you.
[Flirt] I can see what I want.
Mm. You can be... real convincing. Pleasure first. Business later.
What? You're going off with him?
Shut up, Obenth.
Then I don't suppose you, pretty lady....
You're kidding, right?
I have things to do, agent. I'll catch up to you later.
Okay. Let's dance. Later, you tell me what you really want. In private.
You're going to make a bad girl out of me. But I can't say "no" to you.
Here--codes to daddy's workshop. Should get you in, if you can get a guard's keycard. You have to visit me again if it works.
You can be sure I'll do my best.
I'd like that.
Hey, it's something. Kisses....
You don't have to worry about that. Imperial Intelligence will be watching you, Samara.
We'll have our eye on you.
What? But I didn't do anything wrong. I thought I was helping you....
I'm not interested in your father. Right now, I'm just interested in you.
[Flirt] I can see what I want.
No... no, I don't think you are. It's him you're interested in, isn't it? Huh. He's with Lord Grathan these days.
What's your father so worried about people finding?
Really after? Like what?
I get it. It's him you're interested in, right? He's with Lord Grathan these days.
Theovor doesn't approve of anyone in the government. That's why I need to see him.
Your father is my target.
I need to talk to your father, Samara--he's been causing us trouble.
It's about your dad.
Dad's working for Lord Grathan these days--creepy guy.
Anyway, if you want to talk to Theovor, not sure what I can do. He isn't seeing a lot of visitors.
What do you want in return for helping us?
Let's make a deal, all right?
I think you can help me. Give me a few hours, and I think you'll be begging to help me.
[Flirt] Work with me, babe.
Come on--give me what I need, then you can get back to your party.
You can help me.
Ha! Listen up--I'm pretty, but I'm not dumb.
My father's inventions made us rich. So, I don't want that taken away--no government seizure, okay?
I want all his credits, all his property transferred to my accounts. Seem like a good deal?
Watcher Two--I assume you're following along. Can we accommodate her?
Let me call in to base.
If the information pans out, we'll give you what you want, Samara.
Well--ah! Okay. Good, then. We've got terms.
Let me suggest an alternative: Help us, and I won't delete your existing credit accounts.
You're not getting anything.
What? That's not fair! Damn.
You want to see my father that bad, I'll tell you how to get to him.
Theovor's workshop is in Lord Grathan's estate. It's sealed tight--I'll give you my codes, but you still need a guard's keycard.
Sounds like a good deal for you. Not for us.
No more games. [Hurt her]
I tried to ask nicely, but I'm running out of patience.
Start talking. [Hurt her]
Ah! What the--?
What did you--what....
I was wondering when you'd get around to that.
That's enough. Please....
Ready to talk?
Listen to me, Samara. Just help me, and I'll stop.
I don't like hurting you.
Look around you, Samara. No one here will stop me from hurting you; I can keep going until you break.
There isn't anyone to help.
No--please. Look, dad's workshop is in Lord Grathan's estate. I've got codes to get in... you can get a keycard from the guards.
That's everything I know. Just stop.
Don't worry. You'll be fine as soon as you get to a medical center.
Everything will be okay.
You hear that? You'll be fine, Samara. Let's go.
Get away from me. I can go myself.
It's about time.
Come on, Samara. Let's get you out of here.
You can get me inside Theovor Mindak's workshop. The Empire expects your cooperation.
Help us--or else.
I think a chill just ran up my spine.
Okay. Okay! I didn't realize it'd gotten that... serious with him. Never liked dad much anyway.
You can have my access codes. They'll get you inside Theovor's space at Lord Grathan's estate--probably into some of his storage units, too.
You'll need a keycard, but the guards carry those. I usually just ask someone to swipe me through.
Your assistance will be remembered.
Thank you.
Your father will be proud, being turned over to Intelligence by his own family.
You're an awful daughter.
Not like I have a choice.
How do I know this isn't a trick? Some ploy to save Theovor?
I don't trust you.
Look, I don't need trouble. I'd rather throw my lot in with you than with dad. So we're square, right?
We're finished here. Stay out of trouble.
That's all I need.
Fine. I have a party to get back to....
I'll try to go easy on Theovor when we find him.
Don't worry about your father.
Sure, but... don't try too hard. We were never that close.
Letting you go is too much of a risk. I can't have you warning your father.
What? Wait--!
Ah! Please... whatever she was involved in, no one here knows anything.
Move along--there's nothing to see.
Get out of here.
Never defy Imperial Intelligence. Are we clear on that?
Let this be a lesson.
She was a traitor to the Empire. She deserved her fate.
She had to be executed.
Okay. Okay. I understand. I'm going to go.
Whatever you want, I'm really not interested.
I'm trying to have a conversation right now, thanks.
You can't live. [Kill her]
You can't live. [Kill her]
